lines.gurmukhi: jYsy dIp dIpq pqMg lot poq hoq kbhUM kY jÍwrw mY prq jr jwie hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Deep Deepat Patang Lot Pot Hota , Kabahoon Kai Jvaaraa Mai Parat Jar Jaai Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a moth is enamored by the flame of a lamp, circles around it, and one day falls in the flame and burns himself.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Kg idnpRiq cog cuig AwvY auif kwhU idn PwsI PwsY bhurRXo n Awie hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Khag Dinaprati Chog Chougi Aavai Udi , Kaahoo Din Dhaasee Dhaasai Bahuryo N Aai Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a bird picks grains and worms the whole day and return to his nest as the sun sets, but some day, it is caught in the net of a bird catcher and does not return to its nest.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Al kml kml pRiq KojY inq kbhUM kml dl sMpt smwie hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Al Kamal Kamal Prati Khojai Nita , Kabahoon Kamal Dal Sanpat Samaai Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a black bee keep searching and smelling elixir from various lotus flowers, but one day it is caught in the boxlike flower.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurbwnI Avgwhn krq icq kbhUM mgn hÍY sbd aurJwie hY ]590]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gurbaanee Avagaahan Karat Chita , Kabahoon Magan Hvai Sabad Urajhaai Hai ?590?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, a seeker perpetually dives in Gurbani, but some day he becomes so engrossed in Gurbani that he is absorbed in Guru's words.  (590)
